result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan St Portia McClain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 9 days time served.
*Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
*Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

*No contact with firearms.
*48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

*NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
*3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren).

*Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
*Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*Parenting classes.
*Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: *STAYED pending a review on July 15, 2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Count 1 conditions apply except for condition time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ethan St Portia McClain

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in court.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 180 days in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 9 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 1:  Serve 60 days in the House of Correction as condition time, STAYED pending a review on July 15, 2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren).
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Counts 1 and 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders the Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer DISMISSED.  

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 2 as Amended:   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Parties request an adjourned sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.  Court vacates jury trial date of 3-24-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

16RM001849  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/12/2015
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial and jur trial in Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.L.M. (10/27/92).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Ethan St Portia McClain in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
